bibl.title: The Stanzaic Architecture of Isidorus, Hymns 2 and 4 (SEG 8.549 and 51).
bibl.note: Both elegiac hymns are composed as a series of five-couplet elegiac stanzas, either because this reflects an otherwise lost tradition for processions and other rituals or because of influence from Callimachus.
bibl.seg: Faraone Christopher A., The Stanzaic Architecture of Isidorus, Hymns 2 and 4 (SEG 8.549 and 51).

Both elegiac hymns are composed as a series of five-couplet elegiac stanzas, either because this reflects an otherwise lost tradition for processions and other rituals or because of influence from Callimachus.
